headline: Dirt Cake
description: This dirt cake recipe is a favorite, easy, no-bake dessert made with layers of creamy vanilla pudding and finely crushed chocolate sandwich cookies.

video.description: Fool 'em with a fun cake that looks just like a flower pot.
video.name: Dirt Cake I

name: Dirt Cake
recipeIngredient: 32 ounces chocolate sandwich cookies with creme filling
1 (12 ounce) container frozen whipped topping, thawed
2 (3.5 ounce) packages instant vanilla pudding mix

recipeInstructions.text: Finely crush chocolate cookies in a food processor; set crumbs aside.
Combine cream cheese, butter, and confectioner's sugar in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until smooth.
Whisk milk, whipped topping, and pudding together in a separate large bowl; fold in cream cheese mixture until well combined.
Alternately layer crushed cookies and pudding mixture in a medium flower pot, starting and ending with cookies. Chill dirt cake in the refrigerator until ready to serve; garnish as desired.

review.reviewBody: It was delicious and everyone enjoyed it; will definitely make it again.

Not sure where these people are from, but I don't like my pudding in liquid form. 3.5 cups of milk may have been what over did it so I'd stick to 2.5 cups. After 24 hours in the fridge, the pudding is STILL liquid. Stick to 2.5 cups and if you need to add more you can add more.

Worst recipe ever! I followed the instructions word for word and it came out really runny even after refrigerating it for hours. I'm pretty sure this recipe could be made with just whip cream and pudding.

Most Fun Cake Ever! I remember being surprised finding this cake in the fridge when I was 6 y/o. My step Mom made it in a flower pot and she put a fake flower in it. I thought it was a real plant. Until she explained how we were going to trick my Dad. lol good memories!
I added another half a cup of milk! Only because it was still so thick and it hadn't even sat yet! Turned out great Thanks for sharing

I’ve made one of these for my son’s birthday for several years now. He’s 21 :) Don’t be like me and think you can skip the step where you make the pudding mixture separately. I did that and it didn’t thicken. All was not lost. The cool whip seemed to rise to the top, so I used that in the cake. I had some extra pudding mixes and made them with 25% less milk than required, then combined that with a block of cream cheese that I whipped with 1/4 c of milk. It turned out well. Since he’s 21 and no longer obsessed with gummy worms I used OMG’s in the layers and on top. YUM! Also, 1 family pack of Oreos was plenty for my needs.

My daughter turned 13 this year and this has been her birthday cake since she was about 6 years old, I made it for Easter one year and she fell in love with it, this is the best recipe for it I’ve found, however, I mix the pudding and milk and then add the cool whip and creamed butter mixture, it just makes more sense to do it that way, it’s always a big hit at our house and my kids are not sweet eaters.

I like the recipe however like a lot of other people i made a few tweaks. after I did these it turned out perfect. I did not add butter i don't see the reason it doesn't add anything to it. With the pudding mix i add one vanilla and one chocolate. My family thinks it tastes better that way and we have tried with just vanilla and just chocolate. I think adding one of each taste better.
This makes A LOT. I would halve it next time, but maybe keep the same amount of Oreos.
This was delicious. We add a layer of chocolate pudding and small pieces of soft brownies.
I changed the sugar to 2 cups and pudding to 3 with cool whip and 5 cups milk
I did exactly what the recipe said to the t, but it came out alittle runny. Anyway to fix that?
it was really good

I made this for a friend of mine who said she had never heard of dirt cake or tried it. 

I didn’t care for this recipe because it wasn’t really specific. For instance, the 32oz of sandwich cookies. Does that mean I need to buy 2 packages of the double stuf Oreos since 1 family pack is only 22.4oz? Also, I was always taught that if you’re going to add a whipped topping, that is your last step before putting it together so you don’t lose the fluffiness when you fold it in. Meaning you would have to add the cream cheese mixture to the pudding, mix it well, then fold in the cool whip. Also, it doesn’t look talk about all the substitutions you could do with this recipe. I made mine with sugar free chocolate fudge and cheesecake pudding mixes, with skim milk. Making one layer white and the other layer brown. And I simply just split the cream cheese mixture and cool whip in half for each pudding. I also just used 1 package of the double stuf Oreos, the majority I crushed in the food processor, but left 7-8 which I hand chopped on a cutting board to make it look like potting soil. It came out tasting great.
Delicious!
Simple, adorable and delicious! This is a wonderful desert for a spring or summer time BBQ.

This was disgusting. Why does this need so many different fats mixed together? The combo isn't doing anyone any favors. Even the kids had a few bites and moved along. Way too rich, way too fatty, way too sweet. Please, do your internal organs a favor and don't make this recipe. The same idea can be executed without making the creamy layers so fatty. The kids just want the gummy worms anyways.
My family just loves it specially the grandkids.

This was a Thanksgiving hit! I tweaked my recipe just a tad, only because I was short on oreos. I mixed my ingredients together a bit differently so that I would not have to deal with clumps. SO GOOD!

The first time I had Dirt Cake as a kid, I absolutely loved it!! It's just so creative, fun, and delicious too!! I didn't have any cream cheese on hand so I used vanilla pudding on it's own. I added 1/2 teaspoon of ground cinnamon to the crushed cream filled cookies, which made it even more delicious!! Then, I added crumbled pieces of angel food cake to crumbled chocolate fudge (Made with a box cake mix.) cake so the mix would look more like potting soil. I added coconut flakes colored with green food coloring on top to look like grass and sprinkled chopped walnuts on top to look like rocks. My daughter loved it for her 10th birthday!!
yummy cake
love the recipe and highly suggest this cake recipe!!!!!!!!!

Tips:
1. Remove the filling from the cookies to make the dirt. I used my nutribullet to process them and if I didn’t remove the filling the cookies would stick together and not crumble. 
2. The sugar is not necessary the pudding and cool whip is really sweet already. 
3. Buy INSTANT pudding and make that first before mixing other ingredients. 
4. Thaw out cool whip and cream cheese. I put them both in hot water containers to thaw out I used my mixer to mix all ingredients together. 
5. I didn’t use butter and followed the other users tip by adding 2Tbs of milk to substitute and I didn’t miss it. 
6. I used green food coloring and shredded coconut to make grass.
Yummmmmmmmm!
no it was good

I wasted so much food because the recipe is unclear. Please change the recipe and make it more specific. I will never use this recipe, nor recommend it to my book club. I was going to give the dirt cake to them, but that is no longer an option since I ended up with this.
The pudding mixture is just sweet enough and it was creamier than when I have made it in the past. Very excited to eat it for our birthday celebration.
The pudding mixture is just sweet enough and it was creamier than when I have made it in the past. Very excited to eat it for our birthday celebration.
No changes made to original recipe
delish, kids (and adults) loved it

I make this twice a year once at Christmas and then at Easter my grand boys love it and always ask for it but it is rich and their mom try's to limit sugar. I tried several others years ago but this one is the best and so easy. The only thing I change is the middle layer I use a layer of cho. pudding. It looks so nice in my glass bowl.
I used golden Oreos to simulate ice since I was making a hockey rink and also they were the thins so less filling to speckle.

I followed the comments and didn’t add the powdered sugar. It was plenty sweet. I like the butter included vs removing and adding milk. It adds a complexity to the flavor. Others noted that the recipe calls for too many cookies. I just chopped up what I needed, which was about half of what it called for. I recommend this dish. It’s easy and good.
I loved this recipe! Had fun with it this Halloween - I even used it again for the Fight Cancer Pink-Out day by using Strawberry instant pudding in a pink jack-o-lantern with roses coming out of it!

This recipe is my go to potluck dish. I get so many compliments every time I make this one co-worker once called it the “heavenly chocolate dessert”... but no matter what you call it, it is certainly one of my favorite dessert recipes. However I normally just use one normal sized package if Oreos per batch.
I make it every year for my bday cause that's what my son wants. He loves it
Great recipe! Super easy and always a hit at parties because of how novel it is and delicious it is!
This is my kids' favorite. Even adults like it!

I make this for pot lucks using a trifle bowl so you can see the layers. I omit the butter and powdered sugar, don't think it needs it. I also put fresh flowers on the top using floraI water 
 tubes (sterilized of course). Always come home with an empty bowl.
The cake was very tasty! If you put gummy worms on the top or inside of the layered cake it would look more realistic.
People are complaining the recipe makes too much. It doesn’t. You just have to use the right size container. Easy to make. So good that there were no leftovers.
Really enjoyed it. I’m not a big fan of chocolate the vanilla was a good idea.

I made this for a work potluck, and it was a big hit. This is so good and a good conversation piece as well. And really easy to put together. You can use tin foil to line the pot or in this case I use a Crockpot Liner. To keep it from sliding I lined the edge up around the pot so it would overhang too much and a few strips of two sided sticking tape. You can get a beach shovel, a plastic flower, and gummy worms from the dollar store, I stuck the flower in between the liner and the pot so it could stay in place during the serving of it. Big winner and will make again.
Made according to recipe - delicious! More fluffy, creamy, and interesting flavor than pudding alone! Made a small one with glutino cookies for my gluten free friend.
Very good! I didn’t use the butter and I halved the amount of confectioners sugar.
Wow! Best dirt cake I have ever made!
good cool
The dirt cup is so yum yum delicious fun!!!
I made this as a special request from one of my students for his birthday. It was a huge hit with my group of high school seniors!
This is amazing! Recipe was easy and delicious! Adults loved it just as much as the kids! It is going to know be a go to dessert when we entertain or go to someone’s house!!

it is too sweet for me, and I only used 1/3 cup sugar. But I needed a theme kitty litter cake. only difference was top layer was a mixture of Graham crackers and oreos, and I used mini twix instead of worms. I also mixed a few of the oreo crumbs into the pudding.
Best dirt cake! I followed all the directions and it came our great! Tons of compliments.
Delicious!!!

I used this recipe for may daughters first birthday and it was a HUGE hit. I added "magic mushrooms" (mini marshmellows on a toothpick topped with a strawberry) and it couldn't have been cuter. Everyone asked me where I got the recipe!
Great dessert. As much as I love butter, I left it out. I didn't think the extra fat was needed. I was right. It was excellent.

This is a terrific recipe, a favorite with our grandson. He always requests it for his birthday cake. I don't make any changes to the recipe. My daughter and I make a fun optional version of this on Halloween. We put it in a sheet cake pan and add candy skeleton pieces emerging and Milano cookies standing upright with writing on them to look like tombstones - Presto! A Halloween graveyard cake - great fun for your Halloween party.
There was none leftover.

Very good! Would try chocolate pudding next time. Didn’t own a food processor, so chopping the ores was a bit tedious. Didn’t have enough Oreo for top layer, so mixed some chocolate Oreo graham cracker crumbs in, which made it look great.

Great recipe. I took some advice from previous reviews and made just a few changes. 
I let the cream cheese sit out to soften a bit and then mixed the milk in really well with a handheld mixer. I then added the 2-boxes of instant pudding and mixed again. I set that aside and worked on the whip cream. 
I’m not a fan of cool whip so I put a tablespoon of powdered sugar into 16-oz heavy whipping cream and mixed that until stiff. I then folded the pudding/cream cheese/ milk combo into the heavy whipping cream and let that hang out in the fridge until we I had the Oreos ready to go. 
I used regular Oreos vs double stuff so I’d get more of a dirt effect. I did the food processor method and then layered as suggested and placed gummy worms intermittently. We have a flower pot we use each time we make this and finish it off with fake flowers saved for this too.

I didn’t add the powder sugar, and I only used about 20 oz of Oreos. It was a hit at the party. I didn’t add sugar accidentally, and it was still delicious. I plan on making it without sugar from now on just to cut down on sugars.
I use low fat milk, cool whip lite, 1/3 less fat cream cheese, and Oreo thins. My family loves it.

very good recipe, and easy. i wasn't sure if i should mix the coolwip in with the pudding right away, so i just let the pudding set up a little bit before combining, still turned out great. a big hit at Easter.
Make this all the time. Everyone loves it. Thanks
The flavor of the pudding and cheese mix is really good. I used it in individual cups for a school snack. I think the kids will love it!!!
Made it as the recipe called for and took it to a party. I didn’t have to worry about bringing any leftovers home. It was a huge hit!!
This recipe works every time. I add a teaspoon of vanilla to my mixture.
I made it just the way is says and i came with jello slop. Almost soupy looking . 10 hours in the fridge and nothing. What a waste of ingredients.
Great kid friendly dessert!
Delicious and easy! Tastes like the Oreo mousse dessert I buy at the Amish market!
Good, but I don't understand why you need to add butter and cream cheese to this. It works fine without, and when I mixed them together, I ended up with gross butter lumps scattered throughout. Elgh.
A family favorite! The kids request it year after year for their birthdays and the adults love it too! You're never too old for Dirt Cake!

I have been making this for years but have never added the sugar or butter and it is great without it. I am making it today for my brother. This is a great recipe either way. Also, for the ones complaining about boiling the pudding,..the recipe clearly state to use INSTANT pudding! There is no stove needed for this recipe!! Read and focus people...lol
I used dark chocolate pudding instead of vanilla - made it really rich. This is so much fun to make with kids - we added gummy worms as decorations.
Quick and easy recipe. We've also made this with vanilla Oreos and it came out great! My family loves this!

Will most certainly will make many more times. My grandkids and great grandkids always want it for their birthdays!! Easy to make. Just takes a little time and a lot of ,but so worth the happy faces! I did not use the flower pot. Just a 9x13 pan.
This is very rich and one of my favorite deserts! But you ppdo need to mix the milk and pudding before folding in the cool whip.
This recipe is always a big hit. My middle son has asked for it as his birthday cake three times now in the past 4 years. The only thing I change is that I use chocolate pudding instead of vanilla.
I found some small plastic flower pots at a discount store, put the cake in those, and topped it with edible Easter grass and flower suckers.
I've made this for years and it's always a hit with the kids at boring adult dinners!
This is my go to for a pot luck! Recipes yields a ton! I serve mine in a triffle dish so you can see the layers, and it always gets rave reviews. Delicious and easy. 5 stars.

**WARNING** EXTREMELY ADDICTIVE**

OMG, I can eat this stuff for breakfast, lunch, dinner or dessert doesn't matter because it is amazing. If you can handle the calories that is.

My grandma has been making me dirty cake FOREVER she is older now and doesn't bake & of course I wanted to take over so I asked her for her recipe and of course she didn't even make one. I made this and it taste just like grandma's & she loved it too
I used a pack of cheesecake pudding and a pack of french vanilla instead of the regular vanilla.

I used this recipe as a starting point to make a few changes. I used the butter called for and Instead of a block of cream cheese I bought a whipped cream cheese. Instead of store bought "READY WHIP" I used homemade, hand whipped, heavy whipping cream *I found the recipie at allrecipes.com. I split this whipped cream between both a milk chocolate, and a dark chocolate pudding. I also split the cream cheese and butter mixture between the two pudding flavors. This added a few extra steps but well worth the effort for real whipped cream and the effect of layering the two chocolates. This is all I changed otherwise I followed the directions indicated in this recipe. 
I Garnished it with sour gummie worms and a pretty purple silk flower.
It was a hit and everyone requested i make it again soon
I made this for our grandchildren and they thought something was wrong with it because it "tasted different!" Discovered it was the addition of the cream cheese. next time I will leave it out.

Very good as is but when I made it a second time I followed someone's advice of omitting the stick of butter and adding just a few tablespoons of milk to help mix the cream cheese. This is the way to go! Did not miss the butter one bit! That I think propels it to 5 stars for the obvious decrease in calories.
Delicious!! Everyone loved it!
I have now made this for 2 different birthday parties. It's always a huge hit.
This has been a hit at every office party! It's easy to put together and everyone loves it.

Upon careful consideration of the comments , and after struggling to understand why this recipe "needs" butter...I took a chance and omitted the butter completely. Reason being, the cream cheese was already adding fat and smoothness, not to mention the fat from the milk? I also was concerned that it might be, not just sweet, but too sweet because I' m kind of sensitive to that. But cream cheese by itself is NOT sweet. So I added 1/4 c of powdered sugar rather than the full amount. I used Truwhip (no hydrogenation, natural ingedients) instead of CoolWhip but I believe the sweetness is the same?The end result was a little sweet-without the cookie crumbs, so I knew WITH the cookie crumbs it was going to taste great. And it did! Thanks!
Made this for my husband's birthday (his request!) and it was a huge hit with everyone! SO not healthy but yummy for 1 x a year. Needed lots more Oreos than called for, makes a LOT of cream

Everyone loves when I make this. My family and I don't care for the added gummy candies, so we skip those. Sometimes we'll add marshmallow Peeps to the top for decorations (easter, Peep ghosts and pumpkins for Halloween).
Phenomenal! Everyone LOVED it!!

The batter tastes like pure lard with all that butter and the finished product just tastes like a bowl of sugar. I mixed chocolate and French vanilla for a more "muddy" look that also tastes better than plain vanilla. As for the amount of cookies, I probably could have used more, though this could be due to one or both of the following: 1) the batter was too rich so thicker layers of cookie crumbs would have served to break up the lard consistency of the batter. 2) I manually crushed the Oreos, so they may not have been as fine as they would be had I used a food professor.

We tweaked it a bit and eliminated the butter. It is always a huge hit. A couple of tips: Add a half teaspoon of mint extract, mint oreos and some green food coloring for a great mint dirt cake. (about 60 drops of green food coloring = the color of the mint oreo filling. Still experimenting and haven't converted that to a measurement yet.) Another tip is don't use anything fat free. I tried it with fat free cream cheese and it did not set up. The silver lining, though, was that in the freezer it froze to about the consistency of a low fat ice cream cake. My wife said, for a summer treat, this might actually be better than a traditional dirt cake! Oh well, back to the lab (kitchen) for more experiments!
Great recipe. I also make sand cake switching out Oreos for Nilla wafers. We put it in new sand buckets for my daughter's beach birthday party.

I loved this, but as written it could used some tweaks. I left the butter out, because it just seemed completely unnecessary. Why add those extra calories when it tastes great without it? I used one package of oreos (14 oz.) and that was plenty. Also, I think the recipe should only call for an 8 oz. tub of cool whip; I used 12 oz. and it made way too much pudding mixture. I couldn't fit it all in the pot. A very fun, creative and yummy desert!

The butter was way too much. I really think it could be made without it. I didn't follow the directions exactly and my butter wasn't softened enough, so I had chunks of butter throughout. It was a little gross. I think if I left the butter out it would have been perfect. I love the concept and taste. My 4yo daughter thought it was hilarious.
I make this all the time with french vanilla pudding, cream cheese, and cool whip. Never used butter and confectioners sugar in it that seems to be too rich.
